item.title: 1.0_network_devices.net
item.description:
Computer networks rely on many devices, protocols, services, stardards, etc. that enable us to communicate with one another.

OSI MODEL

The Open Systems Interconnection (OSI) Model was created to standardize and streamline communication between networked devices. OSI Reference Model

  • Layer 7 Application
  • Layer 6 Presentation
  • Layer 5 Session
  • Layer 4 Transport
  • Layer 3 Network
  • Layer 2 Data Link
  • Layer 1 Physical

Most devices operate on more than one layer, but to determine which layer a device is operating on, you must first identify the highest layer it is functioning on.
